    • Method Detail

      • promptForMenuSelection

        public static int promptForMenuSelection(java.lang.String[] options,
                                         boolean withQuit)
        Generates a console-based menu using the Strings in options as the menu items. Reserves the number 0 for the "quit" option when withQuit is true.
        Parameters:
        options - - Strings representing the menu options
        withQuit - - adds option 0 for "quit" when true
        Returns:
        the int of the selection made by the user

      • promptForBool

        public static boolean promptForBool(java.lang.String prompt,
                                    java.lang.String trueString,
                                    java.lang.String falseString)
        Generates a prompt that expects the user to enter one of two responses that will equate to a boolean value. The trueString represents the case insensitive response that will equate to true. The falseString acts similarly, but for a false boolean value. Example: Assume this method is called with a trueString argument of "yes" and a falseString argument of "no". If the enters "YES", the method returns true. If the user enters "no", the method returns false. All other inputs are considered invalid, the user will be informed, and the prompt will repeat.
        Parameters:
        prompt - - the prompt to be displayed to the user
        trueString - - the case insensitive value that will evaluate to true
        falseString - - the case insensitive value that will evaluate to false
        Returns:
        the boolean value

      • promptForByte

        public static byte promptForByte(java.lang.String prompt,
                                 byte min,
                                 byte max)
        Generates a prompt that expects a numeric input representing a byte value. This method loops until valid input is given.
        Parameters:
        prompt - - the prompt to be displayed to the user
        min - - the inclusive minimum boundary
        max - - the inclusive maximum boundary
        Returns:
        the byte value

        public static short promptForShort(java.lang.String prompt,

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the short value

      • promptForInput

        public static java.lang.String promptForInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                              boolean allowEmpty)
        Generates a prompt that allows the user to enter any response and returns the String. When allowEmpty is true, empty responses are valid. When false, responses must contain at least one character (including whitespace).
        Parameters:
        prompt - - the prompt to be displayed to the user.
        allowEmpty - - when true, makes empty responses valid
        Returns:
        the input from the user as a String

      • promptForChar

        public static char promptForChar(java.lang.String prompt,
                                 char min,
                                 char max)
        Generates a prompt that expects a single character input representing a char value. This method loops until valid input is given.
        Parameters:
        prompt - - the prompt to be displayed to the user
        min - - the inclusive minimum boundary
        max - - the inclusive maximum boundary
        Returns:
        the char value
